title: Sōja
text:
is a <a href="Cities%20of%20Japan">city</a> located in <a href="Okayama%20Prefecture">Okayama Prefecture</a>, <a href="Japan">Japan</a>. As of 2020, the city has an estimated <a href="population">population</a> of 69,343 and a <a href="population%20density">population density</a> of 322 persons per km2. The total area is 211.90 km2.
History.
In the 7th century, <a href="Ki%20Castle">Ki Castle</a> was built atop the mountain Kijōyama. Long in ruins, excavation and partial reconstruction began in 1999.
The city was founded on March 31, 1954.
On March 22, 2005, the villages of <a href="Yamate%2C%20Okayama">Yamate</a> and <a href="Kiyone%2C%20Okayama">Kiyone</a> (both from <a href="Tsukubo%20District%2C%20Okayama">Tsukubo District</a>) were merged into Sōja.
Geography.
Adjacent municipalities.
Sōja is surrounded by the following cities and towns, all within <a href="Okayama%20Prefecture">Okayama Prefecture</a>.
Sister cities.
Sōja has been twinned with <a href="Chino%2C%20Nagano">Chino, Nagano</a> in Japan since 1984.
